intro: Cyrtopera eylesii, commonly known as the Eyles' Cyrtopera, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests or wetlands. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in coastal or subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
